LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Indroduction.label: Prison labor
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Indroduction.helpText:
You can force your prisoners to do labor.

To do so you must select "Force to work" option from "Prisoner" pane

Prisoners will work on orders and bills that are in allowed area. Make sure prisoners can reach their work.

They can only cook, mine, cut plants, haul, clean, or grow plants, that do not require special skills.

Prisoner sometimes refuses to work. Reasons can be different. He can be injured, hungry, tired, or not motivated enough.

HINT: You can assign work types in "Work" pane.

HINT: If you put a stove in a prison cell make sure they can reach raw food.

HINT: You can let prioners moving through doors by leaving them open.
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Motivation.label: Motivating prisoners
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Motivation.helpText:
One of yours prisoners stopped working.
He won't work any longer, unless he gets motivated.

You can check status of motivation in "Needs" tab.

Make sure you have enough wardens (check "Work" tab), or draft one of your colonist and order him to stand around your prisoners.

Low motivation of prisoners can lead to revolts.
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Growing.label: Growing by prisoners
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Growing.helpText: Prisoners can only grow plants that don't require any special skills like potato or cotton. They can however gather any plant that is ordered to harvest.
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Management.label: Prison labor management
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Management.helpText:
You can manage your prison labor in several ways.

You can assign work types to prisoners by accessing "Work" tab.

You can restrict when prisoners should work, rest, or sleep by accessing "Restrict" tab.

You can restrict work to "Prisoners only". For work orders that covers area you can choose "Labor area" tool from "Architect"->"Orders" panel.
For bills there is an option "Prisoners only".
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Timetable.label: Prisoners time restrictions
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Timetable.helpText:
You can make time restrictions for prisoners.

"Work" time will force them to work even when they're hungry or tired.

"Joy" time will let them rest from job and get motivation bonus.

"Sleep" time will force them to stay in prison cell.

"Anything" is default setting.
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Treatment.label: Treatment system
LanguageData.PrisonLabor_Treatment.helpText:
In prison labor you need to take care for prisoners. Good treatment can prevent revolts, and can provoke recruit proposition (without recruting process!).

To maintain good treatment status you need to feed prisoners regularly and set some free time so they can regenerate their strength

Treatment will go lower if you beat prisoners, starve them, or exploit in terms of labor.
Good treatment will result in:
 - Random offers with request to join colony
 - Preventing revolts
 - Preventing suicide
